title: An Extraordinary Union (The Loyal League, #1)
author: Alyssa Cole
synopsis: As the Civil War rages across the United States, a courageous pair of spies plunge headlong into the most dangerous mission of their lives: fighting ignorance, lies and threats to create a better world and break the chains of the past... The Civil War is in its initial stages in the country. The Union, formed by the Northern states and led by President Lincoln, is in favor of the abolition of slavery. The Confederacy, made up of Southern states, seeks to separate from the United States in order to maintain the slave system. Elle Burns is a former slave who lives in relative peace with her family in the North. But she also has an iron determination and a photographic memory, so when war breaks out, she becomes an agent of the Loyalty League, knowing she can help the Cause. Malcolm McCall is one of the best detectives in Pinkerton's Secret Service: he has thwarted assassination attempts on the president and dabbled in rebel groups. Now, he's in Richmond posing as a soldier from the South, and he needs to get close to a Confederate senator and his family in search of information - precisely the house in which Elle is infiltrated as a slave. Two secret agents who share a common cause—and an undeniable attraction—Elle and Malcolm team up to expose a plan that could turn the war in the Confederacy's favor. Caught in a web of intrigue, and trying to resist a forbidden passion, the two are willing to risk everything to preserve the Union.
